There is something that i don't understand!
Why the releases always say 720p or 1080p, and most of the time (95%), doesn't have 720p or 1080p.

For example this one has 544p
(is 1280x544) 
This suck, because almost every one have 16:9 screen's, and must see the movies with the black bars.
movies aren't made that way.
thanks great upload

danielcsilva: there is a difference between 1.77 aspect ratio movies and 2.4. The widescreen tvs sold are 16:9(1.7) so a 720p or 1080p fill the whole screen. Many movies are made at a 2.4ar so you have the letterboxing and thus not a true 720 or 1080p when mastered.
